channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addresses rising competition at shareholder meeting after historic stock surge
item.description: Since last year's meeting, Nvidia has been on a historic run.

item.title: Micron shares slide after revenue forecast fails to top estimates
item.description: Micron reported better-than-expected results on Wednesday, but the stock declined on a forecast that was only in line with estimates.

item.title: Federal Reserve says all 31 banks in annual stress test withstood a severe hypothetical downturn
item.description: This year's stress test included JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs, credit card companies including American Express and regional lenders such as Truist.

item.title: Amazon reaches $2 trillion market cap for the first time
item.description: The company joins other tech heavyweights, such as Nvidia, Apple, Amazon and Microsoft, all of which have crossed a $2 trillion market capitalization.

item.title: Amazon plans to launch discount store in bid to fend off Temu and Shein
item.description: Amazon's storefront would directly compete with Temu and Shein, two emerging e-commerce sites with ties to China that have grown in popularity in the U.S.

item.title: Morgan Stanley wealth advisors are about to get an OpenAI-powered assistant to do their grunt work
item.description: The rollout will be a real-world test for the vaunted productivity gains of generative AI, which took the world by storm in late 2022.

item.title: Google is testing facial recognition technology for campus security, starting at site near Seattle
item.description: According to internal documents, Google is testing facial recognition technology at a site in Kirkland, Washington.

item.title: Levi's shares drop 12% as jeans maker's sales disappoint despite denim craze
item.description: Levi has been working to build out its own website and stores, and while the strategy has lifted profits, sales aren't budging much.

item.title: Rivian investment a ‘catch-up move’ for Volkswagen that could take years to pay off, advisory firm says
item.description: Volkswagen’s $5 billion investment in electrical vehicle startup Rivian is a “catch-up move” for the German automaker, Cyrus Mewawalla says.

item.title: Harvard dropouts raise $120 million to take on Nvidia's AI chips
item.description: A team founded by college dropouts has raised $120 million from investors led by Primary Venture Partners to build a new AI chip to take on Nvidia.

item.title: Delta's most exclusive airport lounge opens. Here's what's inside
item.description: The Delta One lounge is the airline's latest effort to reel in customers and offers perks like massages, showers and a high-end restaurant.

item.title: China's EV architect says investing in Europe is a way forward
item.description: Wan Gang became China's minister of Science and Technology around 2010 and is known for spearheading the country's early push into electric cars.

item.title: Southwest Airlines cuts revenue forecast, blaming changing booking patterns
item.description: The company said it still expects record quarterly operating revenue in the second quarter.

item.title: YouTube dominates streaming, forcing media companies to decide whether it's friend or foe
item.description: YouTube is gaining share of viewership on TVs, and legacy media doesn't have a uniform strategy to deal with the threat.

item.title: European stocks close lower as euro extends declines; tech firms nudge higher
item.description: European stocks closed lower Wednesday, extending negative sentiment seen in the previous trading session.

item.title: U.S. chip curbs in Middle East just 'business as usual,' Ooredoo CEO says after Nvidia deal
item.description: Ooredoo earlier this week signed a partnership with Nvidia, marking the chipmaker's first large-scale entry into the Middle East market. The companies did not disclose the value of the deal.

item.title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange lands in Australia after U.S. plea deal
item.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange returned to Australia on Thursday after pleading guilty in a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands.

item.title: Europe is at risk of over-restricting AI and falling behind U.S. and China, Dutch prince says
item.description: Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands told CNBC Europe risks limiting its role in artificial intelligence to being a regulator, rather than an innovator.

item.title: Trade feuds aside, Chinese firms are committed to the U.S. market, survey shows
item.description: A survey of Chinese enterprises in the U.S. has found that a majority remain bullish on the market long-term despite concerns about U.S.-China relations.

item.title: Oil prices move higher despite unexpected build in U.S. crude, gasoline stockpiles
item.description: Crude oil stockpiles rose by 3.6 million barrels last week, according to data released by the Energy Information Administration.

item.title: The yuan's status as a global currency might be gaining ground. But top CEOs see more hurdles to clear
item.description: For China's yuan to be used more globally, the currency needs more "applications" such as stocks and bonds, said Bonnie Chan, CEO of the Hong Kong exchange.

item.title: Nvidia's half-a-trillion dollar wipeout leaves global chip stocks volatile
item.description: Global semiconductor stocks saw volatile trading on Tuesday after a slump in shares of Nvidia during the previous session.

item.title: E-commerce firm Shopee agreed to adjust its practices in Indonesia after watchdog says it violated competition law
item.description: Indonesia Competition Commission said Shopee proposed adjustments to its current practices and that the request has been approved.

item.title: This Southeast Asian city is the world's most expensive for the super rich — Hong Kong comes second
item.description: The price of owning a car in Singapore — the most expensive globally at 2.5 times the average — soared 15% from a year earlier in U.S. dollar terms.

item.title: Britain looks to upstage France with play for world's third major AI hub after U.S., China
item.description: Global tech entrepreneurs and investors are touting the U.K. as a place to invest in when it comes to artificial intelligence. But it faces competition.

item.title: U.S. ambassador accuses China of undermining bilateral ties, Wall Street Journal reports
item.description: This comes after ties between the U.S. and China have somewhat warmed after Xi and Biden met in November.

item.title: Rivian secures up to $5 billion from Volkswagen, shares soar more than 50%
item.description: Volkswagen plans to invest up to $5 billion in electric vehicle startup Rivian, starting with an initial investment of $1 billion.

item.title: Sixteen Nobel Prize-winning economists warn a second Trump term would 'reignite' inflation
item.description: Trump says he would make his first-term tax cuts permanent, impose universal tariffs on all imports and pressure the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.

item.title: Novo Nordisk's Wegovy weight loss drug approved in China
item.description: Novo Nordisk said Tuesday that its Wegovy weight loss treatment has been approved in China for long-term weight management.

item.title: China’s Chang’e-6 lunar probe returns with first-ever samples from far side of the moon
item.description: China's Chang'e-6 lunar probe returned to Earth on Tuesday, bringing back the first-ever samples from the far side of the moon.
